node.bodyHTML:
This PR contains the following updates:

Package Type Update Change
core-js devDependencies minor 3.6.5 -> 3.7.0

Release Notes

zloirock/core-js

v3.7.0

Compare Source

  • String#replaceAll moved to the stable ES, per June TC39 meeting
  • Promise.any and AggregateError moved to the stable ES, per July TC39 meeting
  • Added Reflect[@​@​toStringTag], per July TC39 meeting
  • Forced replacement of Array#{ reduce, reduceRight } in Chrome 80-82 because of a bug, #‚Äã766
  • Following the changes in the upsert proposal, { Map, WeakMap }#emplace replace { Map, WeakMap }#upsert, these obsolete methods will be removed in the next major release
  • By the current spec, AggregateError#errors is own data property
  • Added correct iteration closing in the iteration helpers according to the current version of the proposal
  • process.nextTick have a less priority when Promise in the microtask implementation, #‚Äã855
  • Fixed microtask implementation in engines with MutationObserver, but without document, #‚Äã865, #‚Äã866
  • Fixed core-js-builder with an empty (after the targets engines or another filtration) modules list, #‚Äã822
  • Fixed possible twice call of window.onunhandledrejection, #‚Äã760
  • Fixed some possible problems related multiple global copies of core-js, #‚Äã880
  • Added a workaround for 3rd party Reflect.set polyfill bug, #‚Äã847
  • Updated compat data:
    • Chrome up to 86
    • FF up to 82
    • Safari up to 14
  • Updated compat data mapping:
    • iOS up to 14
    • NodeJS up to 15.0
    • Electron up to 11.0
    • Samsung Internet up to 13.0
    • Opera Android up to 60
    • The rest automatically
  • Updated all required dependencies

Renovate configuration

node.bodyHTML:
Describe the bug
When using the react-broadcast package with localstorage-adapter and using Firefox, React detects an infinite re-render and crashes the app.

To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Given the demo app in the flopflip monorepo
  2. Replace the import of @flopflip/react-redux with @flopflip/react-broadcast
  3. Run npm start
  4. Open the page in Firefox
  5. Open the web inspector console, type updateFlags({"incrementSync": true}), and press enter

Expected behavior
The increment button appears on the screen

Actual behavior
The app will crash, with the following message (see screenshot for more details):

Error: "Maximum update depth exceeded. This can happen when a component repeatedly calls setState inside componentWillUpdate or componentDidUpdate. React limits the number of nested updates to prevent infinite loops."

Screenshots

Additional context
Tested using Firefox 70 on multiple machines (Linux and macOS). Appears to work fine on Chromium 77 on Linux.

I've tried this on three separate React apps: the app I was planning to use flopflip on, followed by a bare-bones app I made using create-react-app, before finally reproducing the bug using the demo app for flopflip.

It seems to be an issue specifically with the combination of localstorage-adapter and react-broadcast. localstorage-adapter works fine with react-redux, and launchdarkly-adapter works fine with react-broadcast, but localstorage-adapter with react-broadcast causes the app to crash.

After testing in Chromium, I also noticed that nothing is getting saved to local storage, even though the button appears. Not sure if that's expected behaviour - I simply haven't looked into it yet, because the first issue is more pressing to me.
node.title: App crashes in Firefox when using react-broadcast with the localstorage adapter

node.bodyHTML:
This hook will be a companion to useFeatureToggle and work similar to injectFeatureToggles.

To mirror the behaviour of injectFeatureToggles we will need a useFeatureToggles. Whenever we do we can migrate injectFeatureToggles to "use" useFeatureToggles to pluck the needed flag from the context.

Without it injectFeatureToggles could not be refactored to hooks as the amount of hooks could change which would violate the rules of hooks.

Something like:

const featureToggles = props.flagNames.map(flagName => useFeatureToggle(flagName);

would be invalid and a very hard to catch bug while

const featureToggles = useFeatureToggles(props.flagNames)

is valid.
node.title: Add a `useFeatureToggles` as a companion to `useFeatureToggle`

node.bodyHTML:
This intends to refactor the HoC injectFeatureToggle to use useFeatureToggle under the hood.

This should simplify the logic and access to the context. Maybe tests could need an eye but in general should not need refactoring.
node.title: Refactor `injectFeatureToggle` to use `useFeatureToggle`

node.bodyHTML:
This intends to refactor the HoC injectFeatureToggles to use useFeatureToggles under the hood.

This should simplify the logic and access to the context. Maybe tests could need an eye but in general should not need refactoring.

Contrary to #904 this has a dependency in #903.
node.title: Refactor `injectFeatureToggles` to use `useFeatureToggles`

node.bodyHTML:
This intends to refactor the HoC branchOnFeatureToggle to use useFeatureToggle under the hood.

This should simplify the logic and access to the context. Maybe tests could need an eye but in general should not need refactoring.
node.title: Refactor `branchOnFeatureToggle` to use `useFeatureToggle`

node.bodyHTML:
The Configure component in packages/react uses UNSAFE__componentWillReceiveProps to update and sync the adapter upon prop changes.

By refactoring the component we should be able to change it to a Function Component from a Class Component while using hooks over lifecycle methods.

This change will get a bit hairy as code needs to move a lot and tests are coupled to lifecycle methods and need to be changed to react-testing-library.
node.title: Refactor `Configure` in `react` package to not use `componentWillReceiveProps`

node.bodyHTML:
Mostly HoCs will use React.Component and can be changed to be Function Components.

Given all HoCs use hooks as a building block (see smaller issues) and Configure is refactored to hooks as well (#907) we can should perform quick inventory if all React.Component have been replaced.
node.title: Ensure removal of any `React.Component` in favour of Function Components

node.bodyHTML:
With the new requirement of react-redux supporting hooks we can migrate away from using connect to pluck into the store.

useSelector can be used over connect. When having migrated all HoCs to make use of react-redux's hooks we can likely remove all HoCs in react-redux itself and just implement them with hooks.
node.title: Refactor `react-redux` package to use hooks over `connect` HoC

node.bodyHTML:
By having a more strict react-redux requirement to support hooks the package can now export hooks too.

To have a homogenous API to react-broadcast, react-redux should implement useFeatureToggle and useFeatureToggles.
node.title: Add `useFeatureToggle` and `useFeatureToggles` to react-redux

node.bodyHTML: With the stricter react requirement these forwad-compatible checks can go away.
node.title: Remove checks for availability of hooks

node.bodyHTML:
Describe the bug
I installed @flopflip/react-broadcast 10.0.0 via yarn add @flopflip/react-broadcast@^10.0.0 and tried to use useFeatureToggles in a react app, but it does not appear to exist. It's not listed in the node_modules/@flopflip/react-broadcast/dist/typings/hooks directory, although use-feature-toggle is.

I verified that the node_modules/@flopflip/react-broadcast/package.json showed 10.0.0 as the version. It just looks like the useFeatureToggles hook was not included in the package.

To Reproduce
yarn add @flopflip/react-broadcast@^10.0.0 or yarn upgrade @flopflip/react-broadcast@^10.0.0 in an existing project, then attempt to

import { useFeatureToggles } from '@flopflip/react-broadcast'

and receive an error that useFeatureToggles is not found

Expected behavior
Expect it to be found

Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

Additional context
The project where I'm seeing this is a create-react-app project using TypeScript. I can use useFeatureToggle, no problem, so it appears to just be an issue with the npm package.
node.title: useFeatureToggles not exported in @flopflip/react-broadcast@10.0.0

node.bodyHTML: ToggleFeature in both package can be refactored too.
node.title: Refactor `ToggleFeature` to use `useFeatureToggle`

node.bodyHTML:
Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I'd like to be able to pass custom attributes to the SplitIO Adapter so I can configure my feature flags based on those custom attributes (ie: user platform (ios/android/web)).

see: https://help.split.io/hc/en-us/articles/360020448791-JavaScript-SDK#attribute-syntax

Describe the solution you'd like
I believe we would need to update the SplitioAdapterArgs type, save the new adapter args into adapter state somewhere around here

and then pass it into getTreatments here and here

Describe alternatives you've considered
Not many alternatives, the attributes have to get into the getTreatments call some how :)

If the above makes sense, I can take a stab at making a PR
node.title: Ability to pass attributes to SpiltIO adapter

node.bodyHTML:
Describe the bug
Trying to use the ToggleFeature component with Typescript results in a React component with any for props (which results in not being able to see what props the component accepts).

To Reproduce

  1. Import ToggleFeature in a tsx file
  2. Try to render it.

Expected behavior
It should have expected typings.

Screenshots

Additional context
It may already be solved on master or with some of the new refactor tickets, but I thought it might be useful to track it.
node.title: <ToggleFeature> is typed as React.Component<any>

node.bodyHTML:
Describe the bug
It seems that <ConfigureFlopflip> still triggers state updates, causing act error warnings when running tests.

To Reproduce
See commercetools/merchant-center-application-kit#1340

Expected behavior
No act warnings when running tests
node.title: ConfigureFlopflip causes act error warnings in test environment

node.bodyHTML:
Describe the bug
If the connection to launchdarkly is blocked by adblocker, corporate firewall, or any other means the following error is thrown:

@flopflip/launchdarkly-adapter: please configure adapter before reconfiguring.

Error thrown from here:
https://github.com/tdeekens/flopflip/blob/master/packages/launchdarkly-adapter/modules/adapter/adapter.ts#L239

adapterState.configurationStatus is 1 here: https://github.com/tdeekens/flopflip/blob/master/packages/launchdarkly-adapter/modules/adapter/adapter.ts#L234 which causes the error to be thrown.

Called from here:
https://github.com/tdeekens/flopflip/blob/master/packages/react/modules/components/configure-adapter/configure-adapter.tsx#L218

To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Given launchdarkly adapter is used with the ConfigureFlopFlip component
  2. Then block all requests to *.launchdarkly.com in DevTools

  1. That when refreshing the page the above mentioned error is thrown.

Expected behavior
The configuration error should either fail silently when a connection cannot be established or throw an error in a way that can be handled by developers.

Screenshots
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

Additional context
In our case we cannot render ConfigureFlopFlip component until the user is authorized and logged in which might explain why reconfigure is called in this manner, but I'm not sure on this.
node.title: If launchdarkly adapter cannot establish network connection, an error is thrown in `reconfigure` that cannot be handled.

node.bodyHTML:
Describe the bug
Packages are not installed after you clone

Version:
npm: 6.14.2
node: v12.14.1
macos: Catalina 10.15.4

Due to un-maintained dependency:
https://www.npmjs.com/package/rollup-plugin-commonjs

It should be changed to: @rollup/plugin-commonjs

To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
npm install after clone

Expected behavior
It should install all the dependency packages successfully
node.title: Dependency installation error

node.title: A lot of babel dependecies are failing to install

node.bodyHTML:
I am doing an upgrade of the packages in our solution, and I see that there has been many new versions of Flopflip, including a major upgrade from 9 to 10. But I struggle to understand what has been changed for me as a user of this library, are there any breaking changes? Are there new features?

It would be really useful if the releases included some hints about what has changed / is new, like e.g. AppInsights does: https://github.com/microsoft/ApplicationInsights-JS/releases

Thank you for providing a useful library!
node.title: Release notes

node.bodyHTML:
I have now upgrade both flopflip and the LD adapter to the latest version and it seems to work fine, but we are getting a lot of these in our console log:

react_devtools_backend.js:6 Warning: @flopflip/launchdarkly-adapter: `getIsReady` has been deprecated. Please use `getIsConfigurationStatus` instead. 
    in ConfigureAdapter (created by ConfigureFlopflip)
    in ConfigureFlopflip (at src/‚Äãindex.js:29)

Seems like the LD adapter needs to be updated?
node.title: Warning from launchdarkly adapter
